text: welcome back to how to kick it today I'm
going to show you how to make
buttercream which is a staple in my
kitchen it's basically the icing on the
cake first you're gonna need 400 grams
of granulated sugar in a stainless steel
pot and a half a cup of water pour the
water over the sugar and then place a
lid on and put your sugar and water on
the heat on high and while this comes to
a boil we're going to crack our eggs
it's very important not to get yolks in
the whites because whites whip better
without yolks because you'll just have a
fat content they make all kinds of
contraptions now that help you separate
eggs but I find that be using the shell
and moving the yolk back and forth which
works well if it ain't broke don't fix
it now that our eggs are separated just
pour them into your mixing bowl
make sure your mixing bowl is nice and
clean set it up on your mixer with the
whip and we should also have on hand our
1 pound of unsalted butter and you want
your butter to be room temperature and
also I have a teaspoon of very good
quality vanilla the hardest part of a
butter cream is that you're at its beck
and call it's kind of like you know
hurry up and wait it's you're just
waiting for it to boil because as soon
as it's at the right temperature you
have to be ready with the next step so
once this is at 230 degrees I'm gonna
flip on the egg whites and let them whip
and by the time this is 240 it will be
ready to pour in which actually cooks
the egg whites as we whip it's true what
they say that a watched pot never boils
it's very true so let's stop watching
okay we're ready for a thermometer so
this is a candy thermometer just clip it
on this side and have it right in the
liquid and when it hits 230 I'm gonna
put on the mixer basically there are
three types of buttercream which are
known as the Italian meringue
buttercream which is what I am making
Swiss meringue buttercream which is the
same ingredients just a different
procedure and American buttercream which
I pretty much all I see American
buttercream is shortening and icing
sugar and so it's more of a frosting or
an icing whereas the Italian meringue
and a Swiss meringue are just as they
say they begin with a beautiful meringue
and then the butter is put in to make a
rich velvety smooth buttercream if
you're gonna bake you can't be afraid to
fail because it will happen and a lot of
baking has to do with knowing your
equipment and you won't know your
equipment until you try it
